Rodrigo Neves Calheiros

  • Endereço para acessar este CV: http://lattes.cnpq.br/3171191979702267

Doutor em Ciência da Computação pela Pontifícia Universidade Católica do Rio Grande do Sul. Recebeu seu grau de mestre em Ciência da Computação pela mesma universidade em 2006 e diploma de graduação em Engenharia de Computação pela Fundação Universidade Federal do Rio Grande em 2004. Seu interesse de pesquisa inclui cloud computing, gerência e escalonamento de recursos computacionais, virtualização e programação em grades computacionais. (Texto informado pelo autor)

Projetos de pesquisa
2013 - Atual
Innovative Solutions for Deployment of BigData and Disaster Management Applications on Clouds
Descrição: Recent developments in the areas of social media mining and mobile computing enabled the processing of data generated continuously by many people in different locations using different devices uploaded to social media sites the extraction meaningful information about disaster events or incidents. However, the amount of data generated continuously is too big, which causes pressure on the computing infrastructures in place to process the data. Cloud computing offers a solution to the problem by providing elastic and pay-as-you-go computing infrastructures. While all of these areas provide fundamentally new paradigms of computing, they lack innovative software frameworks that allow the exploitation of their potential in domains for BigData applications (e.g., disaster management, crowd management, and traffic management). This project is a step in that direction by developing novel techniques for supporting diffusion and analysis (detection, collection, storage, processing, extraction, and reporting) of massive datasets from multiple sources using cloud resources. The outcome of the project will allow online data from multiple sources to be combined in semantically meaningful ways for facilitating just-in-time intelligent decision-making and coordination in BigData application. It will also improve the accessibility of BigData applications to the large user community..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Doutorado: (1) .

Integrantes: Rodrigo Neves Calheiros - Integrante / Rajkumar Buyya - Integrante / Ranjan, Rajiv - Coordenador / R. K. Shyamasundar - Integrante / Arkady Zaslavsky - Integrante / Surya Nepal - Integrante / Shiping Chen - Integrante / R. K. Ghosh - Integrante / Armin Haller - Integrante / Onkar Dabeer - Integrante.
Financiador(es): Department of Innovation, Industry, Science and Research - Auxílio financeiro.
2012 - 2012
Autonomic and cost-effective workflow execution in Cloud computing environments
Descrição: Many of the most challenging and relevant scientific problems can be modelled in the form of computational workflows that describe the order on which different sub-problems have to be executed in computational resources. Among such computational resources, Clouds, which are virtualized resources managed by private organizations and paid per use, are a promising new type of infrastructure to host workflow applications. Nevertheless, there is a lack of support for automated, coordinated, and cost-effective execution of workflows in such environments. This project aims at developing algorithms and policies enabling efficient and cost-optimized execution of workflow applications on Clouds so researchers from different disciplines can take full advantage of these systems for speeding up their complex applications with minimal intervention and cost..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Rodrigo Neves Calheiros - Coordenador.
Financiador(es): The University of Melbourne - Outra.
